txt.en: 'Yes, my Lord Azagath, wet Natathal with your blood,' the Thardúth insists.
Defeat the Alad defending Gârash
'Legolas, stay back, your wounds...'
Defeat Azagath Sea-shadow within the Inner Sanctum
'Mithrandir and I can reseal this prison... but we must work together.'
Survive the impending attack
Azagath screams and clutches his chest, a wave of nausea fills the room. 'Enough! I will not be denied my prize!'
Stop Azagath from achieving his goal
Defeat the Alad defending Gârash\n<rgb=#ff0000>Do not let the Aladi approach Glorfindel or Gandalf</rgb>
'Do not allow the Aladi to reach me!'
'My blood begets my aspects!'
Survive against Gârash, the Emptiness, and seal it within its sarcophagus
Garâsh moves toward Azagath's corpse.
Garâsh, the Emptiness moves toward Azagath's Corpse
Gandalf shouts, 'Back to the Shadow whence you came!'
You must defeat Azagath and stop him from awakening the creature Gârash.

Azagath fled deeper into the inner sanctum. Your pursuit, cut short by fell magic, leaves you with a feeling of unease. Something is amiss. You must survive. The clamour of battle can be heard in corridors beyond.

Your pursuit of Azagath and his companion through the Temple of Utug-bûr leads to the inner sanctum. You feel uneasy and unwell as a chill and odorous breeze envelops you. Something is not right here.
Gârash, the Emptiness begins to swell with power, feeding on the remains of Azagath. Assist Glorfindel and Gandalf in keeping Gârash from leaving the Temple of Utug-bûr.
Azagath says, 'There are others here. Others who followed me across the valley. You are too late, my offering is made.'
Collect a shard to earn the skill: For Middle-earth!
Defeat Azagath Sea-shadow within the Inner Sanctum
Azagath calls out, 'You are too late, my offering is made.'
'You are too late, my offering is made.'
Glorfindel shouts, 'Do not falter, heroes! We shall drive the void back within its prison.'
'This evil cannot be allowed to threaten Middle-earth.'
Survive the impending attack
The ambush is cleared and the door into the deepest part of the sanctum opens. You must proceed deeper, find Azagath and defeat him before he unleashes -- Gârash.
Survive against Gârash, the Emptiness, and seal it within its sarcophagus
Azagath's ambition led to his demise before an ancient Morgothian horror. You must stand against this darkness and assist Glorfindel and Gandalf in containing Gârash, the Emptiness and its servants.
Glorfindel shouts in pain, 'The Elf-stone is shattered! It cannot aid you more.'
Azagath stabs his hand with Natathal. The brooch seems to consume his blood.
Glorfindel says, 'I have not felt a chill like this since... the First Age.'
Collect a skill to call upon Glorfindel's aid throughout the fight.
Azagath passes Natathal to the Thardúth.
'Quickly, gather the shards. We can use them to slow Garâsh.'
The Thardúth calls out, 'Behold, my Lord Azagath, this is the prison of which I spoke.'
Glorfindel calls for a retreat, 'Do not fall to despair!'
Glorfindel cries out, 'Legolas, stay back, your wounds...'
'Behold, my Lord Azagath, this is the prison of which I spoke.'
Glorfindel shouts, 'Mithrandir and I can reseal this prison... but we must work together.'
'Yes, my Lord Azagath, wet Natathal with your blood.'
'I will carry Natathal to the sarcophagus....'
'I have not felt a chill like this since... the First Age.'
Glorfindel shouts, 'Do not let the Aladi to reach me!'
Glorfindel shouts, 'Let the Light inspire you in this dark place!'
Azagath replies, 'A prison no longer. I will free Gârash, consume its power, and become Morgoth's will manifest.'
'Call on me to empower the Elf-stone and I will purge the emptiness.'
Azagath beckons you forward, 'Come forth, I will end your interference, now and forever.'
'Come forth, I will end your interference, now and forever.'
'Look! Fragments of the void. Use the Elf-stones near them to halt their growth!'
The Thardúth bows and takes Natathal, then says, 'I will carry Natathal to the sarcophagus....'
'Back to the Shadow whence you came!'
Glorfindel and Gandalf chant in unison.
Garâsh reanimates Azgath's body, and consumes the void, growing in strength.
The din of battle echoes in the halls surrounding the antechamber
'Do not allow the Aladi to reach me!\q
\qThe Elf-stone is shattered! It cannot aid you more.'
'The shards, Glorfindel, for Middle-earth.'
'Do not fall to despair!'
Gandalf cries out, 'Call on me, friends! I will lend strength to drive back the Darkness.'
Gandalf shouts, 'Look! Fragments of the void. Use the Elf-stones near them to halt their growth!'
'Do not falter, heroes! We shall drive the void back within its prison.'
Gandalf shouts, 'Do not allow the Aladi to reach me!'
'A prison no longer. I will free Gârash, consume its power, and become Morgoth's will manifest.'
Glorfindel says, 'This evil cannot be allowed to threaten Middle-earth.'
'Let the Light inspire you in this dark place!'
'There are others here. Others who followed me across the valley. You are too late, my offering is made.'
Collect a skill to call upon Gandalf's aid throughout the fight.
Temple of Utug-bûr: Inner Sanctum -- Tier 1
'Go, I will end their interference, now and forever.'
'Come, let us finish this, once and for all.'
'Call on me, friends! I will lend strength to drive back the Darkness.'
Azagath brushes the Thardúth away, 'Go, I will end their interference, now and forever.'
Legolas enters the inner sanctum, collapsing and scattering Elf-stone shards to the ground
Stop Azagath from achieving his goal
